conclusion: The task is to analyze how shadows A, B, C, and D change when the light source moves to the back left above the objects.
The image shows four objects casting shadows labeled A, B, C, and D on the ground. The objects are illuminated by a light source.
The current positions and directions of the light source and shadows need to be identified.
The movement of the light source to the back left needs to be visualized.
Shadow A moves toward the left due to the light source's new position.
Shadow B also shifts left and slightly upward.
Shadow C becomes shorter as the light source is now overhead.
Shadow D moves left and slightly upward, similar to B.
Summarizing the changes: A, B, C, and D all move to the left. A becomes shorter, B also becomes shorter and a bit more upright, C becomes shorter, and D becomes a bit more upright and shorter.
